question: What was the mandate of the ‘dual government’ recommended by Lord Clive?
option1: Criminal justice would be left to the Nawabi officials, while civil and fiscal matters would be controlled by the company.
option2: Company will look after fiscal matters and all the rest would be dealt by the Indian rulers.
option3: Indian rulers will deal with all the matters of administration under the supervision of a company official.
option4: Indian rulers will be only titular heads and all the powers shall be directly dealt by the company.
answer: Company will look after fiscal matters and all the rest would be dealt by the Indian rulers.
explanation: Robert Clive established the military and political supremacy of the East India Company in Bengal. Under the system of dual government established by the Britishers the company will look after fiscal matters and all the rest would be dealt by the Indian rulers.
